values.description:
Handheld joystick controllers: 

Logitech:

* X: Accel (A on OSX)
* A: Brake (B on OSX)
* LB: Shift Gear Towards Reverse (Drive -> Neutral -> Reverse)
* RB: Shift Gear Towards Drive (Reverse -> Neutral -> Drive)

Playstation:

* X: Accel 
* O: Brake 
* L1: Shift Gear Towards Reverse
* R1: Shift Gear Towards Drive
values.title: Support changing gears and handheld gamepad controllers

Related PR

values.description:
Ran into a weird problem where the websocket server (PriusHTTPServer) was having problem parsing floating point values like 0.25, 0.5, 0.75, 1.0, etc. Fixed by converting raw bytes into `uint8` and concat'ing them to a `std::string` obj.

Refactored client code to prevent looking up proto files each time a msg is sent.
values.title: Fix protobuf parsing on server side and refactor client code

summary.raw:
Ran into a weird problem where the websocket server (PriusHTTPServer) was having problem parsing floating point values like 0.25, 0.5, 0.75, 1.0, etc. Fixed by converting raw bytes into `uint8` and concat'ing them to a `std::string` obj.

Refactored client code to prevent looking up proto files each time a msg is sent.
summary.html:
Ran into a weird problem where the websocket server (PriusHTTPServer) was having problem parsing floating point values like 0.25, 0.5, 0.75, 1.0, etc. Fixed by converting raw bytes into uint8 and concat'ing them to a std::string obj.

Refactored client code to prevent looking up proto files each time a msg is sent.

values.description: This displays the time until the simulation closes underneath the buttons. It gets the data by subscribing to the topic /time_remaining
values.title: Display simulation time remaining

* 'Help' link opens a modal dialog

* Help Dialog includes Nate's description

* Moved joystick and keyboard controls to the help dialog

values.description:
the updated range values mach the physical racing wheel

I also noticed that steering with joystick control is very sensitive so I implemented joystick curve. Sensitivity now increases exponentially as the axes moves away of the center.
values.title: Update steering wheel range values

summary.raw:
the updated range values mach the physical racing wheel

I also noticed that steering with joystick control is very sensitive so I implemented joystick curve. Sensitivity now increases exponentially as the axes moves away of the center.
summary.html:
the updated range values mach the physical racing wheel

I also noticed that steering with joystick control is very sensitive so I implemented joystick curve. Sensitivity now increases exponentially as the axes moves away of the center.

values.description:
This will send a stop message to the server, which in turn will trigger data upload. 

It does not actually shutdown the simulation since we expect that the whole machine will be shutdown after the data upload.
values.title: Add stop simulation button

summary.raw:
This will send a stop message to the server, which in turn will trigger data upload. 

It does not actually shutdown the simulation since we expect that the whole machine will be shutdown after the data upload.

values.description:
Press `START` to reset simulation or `LSB` on racing wheel

So users on racing wheel won't have to use a mouse to send the reset cmd
values.title: Support sending reset cmd from gamepad
